intro: Ernodea cokeri, commonly known as the Coker's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Ernodea cokeri is a herbaceous perennial that can grow up to several feet in height.
